dataset.name: USGS Gulf of Maine Bathy (3 arc sec), alpha01

metadata.documentation: (alpha v.01) Gulf of Maine bathymetry grid at 3 s resolution. This release is under revision and has not been approved for publication. Please report problems to Rich Signell (rsignell@usgs.gov) . This grid was created using all NOAA digital soundings from the NGDC GEODAS data base (downloaded in May 2008), the NWATL Tiled Database v0.9 from the Canadian Hydrographic Service, swath bathymetry in Massachusetts Bay collected by the USGS in cooperation with the Massachusetts Coastal Zone Management, and the Smith and Sandwell v9.1 worldwide digital elevation and bathymetry model used for offshore waters deeper than 400 m. Data was converted to a horizontal datum of NAD83 and approximate vertical datum of MSL by using the MLW and MLLW water values from the NOAA VDATUM project. Data gaps producing seams were filled with a 5 km bathymetric grid from David Greenberg, Bedford Institute of Oceanography. More complete documentation is under development.

dataset.name: USGS Gulf of Maine Bathy (3 arc sec), alpha03

metadata.documentation: (alpha v.03) Gulf of Maine bathymetry grid at 3 s resolution. This release is under revision and has not been approved for publication. Please report problems to Rich Signell (rsignell@usgs.gov) . This grid was created using all NOAA digital soundings from the NGDC GEODAS data base (downloaded in May 2008), the NWATL Tiled Database v0.9 from the Canadian Hydrographic Service, swath bathymetry in Massachusetts Bay collected by the USGS in cooperation with the Massachusetts Coastal Zone Management, and the Smith and Sandwell v9.1 worldwide digital elevation and bathymetry model used for offshore waters deeper than 400 m. Data was converted to a horizontal datum of NAD83 and approximate vertical datum of MSL by using the MLW and MLLW water values from the NOAA VDATUM project. Data gaps producing seams were filled with the Smith and Sandwell v9.1 data. More complete documentation is under development.

attribute.name: title
attribute.value: 3 sec Digital Elevation Model for the Gulf of Maine

attribute.name: summary
attribute.value: Gulf of Maine bathymetry grid at 3 s resolution. This release is under revision and has not been approved for publication. Please report problems to Rich Signell (rsignell@usgs.gov) . This grid was created using all NOAA digital soundings from the NGDC GEODAS data base (downloaded in May 2008), the NWATL Tiled Database v0.9 from the Canadian Hydrographic Service, swath bathymetry in Massachusetts Bay collected by the USGS in cooperation with the Massachusetts Coastal Zone Management, and the Smith and Sandwell v9.1 worldwide digital elevation and bathymetry model used for offshore waters deeper than 400 m. Data was converted to a horizontal datum of NAD83 and approximate vertical datum of MSL by using the MLW and MLLW water values from the NOAA VDATUM project. Data gaps producing seams were filled with the Smith and Sandwell v9.1 data. This is Science Quality data.

Neither the data Contributor, USGS, nor the United States Government, nor any of their employees or contractors, makes any warranty, express or implied, including warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose, or assumes any legal liability for the accuracy, completeness, or usefulness, of this information.

dataset.name: ETOPO1 (1 arc minute - Worldwide)

documentation.xlink:title: ETOPO1 1 arc minute Global Topography from NGDC (v1)

metadata.documentation: ETOPO1 is a 1 arc-minute global relief model of Earth's surface that integrates land topography and ocean bathymetry. It was built from numerous global and regional data sets. ETOPO1 Bedrock: Grid of Earth's surface that depicts the bedrock underneath the ice sheets.

Amante, C. and B. W. Eakins, ETOPO1 1 Arc-Minute Global Relief Model: Procedures, Data Sources and Analysis, National Geophysical Data Center, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce, Boulder, CO, August 2008.

dataset.name: ETOPO2 Version 2c (2 arc minute - Worldwide)

documentation.xlink:title: ETOPO2 2 arc minute Global Topography from NGDC (v2c)

metadata.documentation: Two-minute gridded global relief for both ocean and land areas are available in the ETOPO2v2 (2006) database. ETOPO2v2c: Cell Centered (pixel registered, where the cell boundaries are lines of even minutes of latitude and longitude, centered on intersections of lines of odd minutes of latitude and longitude).

U.S. Department of Commerce, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, National Geophysical Data Center, 2006. 2-minute Gridded Global Relief Data (ETOPO2v2) http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/mgg/fliers/06mgg01.html

dataset.name: SRTM30+ Version 1.0 (30 arc second - Worldwide)

documentation.xlink:title: SRTM30+ 30 sec Global Topography from UCSD (v1.0)

metadata.documentation: This data consists of 33 files of global topography in the same format as the SRTM30 products distributed by the USGS EROS data center. The grid resolution is 30 second which is roughly one kilometer.

Becker, J. J., D. T. Sandwell, W. H. F. Smith, J. Braud, B. Binder, J. Depner, D. Fabre, J. Factor, S. Ingalls, S-H. Kim, R. Ladner, K. Marks, S. Nelson, A. Pharaoh, G. Sharman, R. Trimmer, J. vonRosenburg, G. Wallace, P. Weatherall., Global Bathymetry and Elevation Data at 30 Arc Seconds Resolution: SRTM30_PLUS, revised for Marine Geodesy, January 20, 2009

David T. Sandwell, Walter H. F. Smith, and Joseph J. Becker Copyright 2008. The Regents of the University of California. All Rights Reserved. Permission to copy, modify and distribute any part of this gridded bathymetry at 30 second resolution for educational, research and non-profit purposes, without fee, and without a written agreement is hereby granted, provided that the above copyright notice, this paragraph and the following three paragraphs appear in all copies. Those desiring to incorporate this global bathymetry into commercial products or use for commercial purposes should contact the Technology Transfer and Intellectual Property Services, University of California, San Diego, 9500 Gilman Drive, Mail Code 0910, La Jolla, CA 92093-0910, Ph: (858) 534-5815, FAX: (858) 534-7345, E-MAIL:invent@ucsd.edu. dataset.name: NOAA Coastal Relief Model (3 arc sec), Vol. 1 (Atlantic Northeast)

metadata.documentation: This Coastal Relief Gridded database provides the first comprehensive view of the US Coastal Zone; one that extends from the coastal state boundaries to as far offshore as the NOS hydrographic data will support a continuous view of the seafloor. In many cases, this seaward limit reaches out to, and in places even beyond the continental slope. The gridded database contains data for the entire coastal zone of the conterminous US, including Hawaii and Puerto Rico. The next area to be included will be Alaska and the Aleutian Islands. The database will eventually include the Great Lakes and surrounding state coastal areas.
Divins, D.L., and D. Metzger, NGDC Coastal Relief Model, http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/mgg/coastal/coastal.html

dataset.name: Puget Sound DEM:2005

metadata.documentation: 30 ft resolution DEM data from David Finlayson was downloaded in ARC ASCII Grid format from http://www.ocean.washington.edu/data/pugetsound/psdem2005.html and converted from State Plane coordinates (Washington North, NAD83) in feet with 30 ft resolution to geographic coordinates (lon,lat) with 0.0001 arc degree resolution using bilinear interpolation. Heights relative to NAVD88 were converted from units of feet to meters.

License for Use: This digital elevation model (DEM) is Copyright 2005 David Finlayson. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons License (see http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0/) To fully comply with the terms of this license you must include the following citation wherever the dataset is used (including in derivative works): Finlayson D.P. (2005) Combined bathymetry and topography of the Puget Lowland, Washington State. University of Washington, (http://www.ocean.washington.edu/data/pugetsound/)

dataset.name: USACE LIDAR Bare Earth Box 061
USACE LIDAR skagit
